stream_context.summary: Kaze works on the overworld: finishes a first-pass polish on the first four overworld sections, begins layout/texture work on section 6, and revisits the cave that connects to Course 3 to remember a missing star idea.

development_findings.summary: The overworld now has 14 planned parts; the first four are "done" to first-pass quality, putting overall overworld progress at roughly 28–30 %. Section 6 layout is underway.
development_findings.quote: I would say overworld 28 % done… we have all the overworlds up to bazaar 1.

development_findings.summary: Biobak has completed Course 2 and is re-working Course 3’s textures; Kaze expects an updated progress tracker.
development_findings.quote: I think Biobak also finished course 2… he said he would update the progress tracker.

development_findings.summary: A one-way mirror lets players peer from the overworld into Course 3, reinforcing world cohesion.
development_findings.quote: In Course 3, there is this mirror here that reflects the level back at you… in the overworld you can look through the mirror.

development_findings.summary: New star concept for the cave: pick up a crystal; while held, a hidden path appears around Mario. Multiple crystals will gate progress across platforms.
development_findings.quote: There would be a crystal here and while you hold the crystal a path around Mario appears and you can only walk it while you are holding the crystal.

development_findings.summary: Falling into the cave water is currently too punishing; plan is to add small recovery platforms or tide-drops back to the start.
development_findings.quote: How do I make falling in here suck less?… a bunch of tiny platforms you can jump on to get back.

development_findings.summary: Casual gameplay beta-testing begins via a Google Form. Testers are asked to play normally rather than hunt bugs.
development_findings.quote: The beta testing here is literally just you casually playing the game.

development_findings.summary: Game could technically release soon, but Kaze has set no hard deadline; amount of polishing remains open-ended.
development_findings.quote: We're almost in a state where we would be able to just release the game, but there is still some polishing I want to do.

development_findings.summary: Area-specific splash-color and light-map tweaks are planned so water effects match each zone and still read well on real N64 hardware.
Mirror splash through walls and brightness on real hardware noted as graphical issues to revisit later.

context_findings.summary: Kaze is producing more YouTube videos to “feed my family,” relying on sponsorship income (e.g., Squarespace pays ~$2,500 per video) and searching for new sponsors.
context_findings.quote: I've been putting in a lot of work and I'm making more videos… because I need to feed my family.

context_findings.summary: Stressed about unresolved German tax issues: paid an accountant who is unresponsive; unsure if German tax office has logged payments; ~$4,000 refund outstanding.
context_findings.quote: I am in this fucked-up situation where I think I did everything right, but I have no proof for it.

context_findings.summary: Philosophy: wants technical videos that are digestible for a casual audience; values Bayesian thinking and public admission of error in debates.
context_findings.quote: We had a disagreement… one party admitted they were wrong. Can you imagine if that existed in real life?

context_findings.summary: Time split between video production, beta-test management, and development slows overworld progress.

biobak.summary: Finished Course 2 and is spearheading Course 3 texture overhaul; is Kaze’s go-to for recalling missing star design details.
biobak.quote: Yeah, Biobak might be the one to know.

key_stories.title: The Forgotten Crystal Star
key_stories.summary: While revisiting the Course 3 cave, Kaze realizes he can’t remember the planned star mechanic. He scrubs old VODs and consults chat, eventually recalling that holding a crystal should reveal a temporary path.
key_stories.challenge: Lost track of the cave’s star concept during months of other tasks.
key_stories.process: Re-watched earlier streams, discussed with chat, planned to ask Biobak, and wrote the idea down once remembered.
key_stories.outcome: Star concept documented for later implementation; cave work put on hold until mechanic is prototyped.
key_stories.key_quote: The idea was there would be a crystal here and while you hold the crystal a path around Mario appears.

key_stories.title: Tax Limbo
key_stories.summary: Kaze paid a German tax accountant before moving to Canada, but the accountant no longer responds. Kaze can’t access the tax office portal and is unsure if payments are registered or a $4 k refund will arrive.
key_stories.challenge: No direct access to German tax office and non-communicative accountant.
key_stories.process: Relies on e-mails, lacks phone, contemplates legal options, vents on stream.
key_stories.outcome: Stress unresolved; vows to learn taxes personally in future.
key_stories.key_quote: I really wish I had looked into taxes myself… now I live in Canada and I know that that's all completely wrong.
